oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Conjugate addition of curcumins to chalcones and azodicarboxylates
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: AYYAGARI, N

oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Michael addition
Curcumins
Chalcones
Azodicarboxylates
ELECTROPHILIC ALPHA-AMINATION
CHIRAL PALLADIUM COMPLEXES
DOUBLE MICHAEL ADDITION
ALPHA,BETA-UNSATURATED KETONES
STEREOSELECTIVE-SYNTHESIS
BETA-KETOESTERS
AMINO-ACIDS
FUNCTIONALIZED CYCLOHEXANONES
ENANTIOSELECTIVE SYNTHESIS
ASYMMETRIC-SYNTHESIS
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Cascade double Michael reaction of curcumins with chalcones in the presence of Cs2CO3 in CH3CN provided highly functionalized cyclohexanones in moderate to good yields (35-77%) and good to excellent diastereoselectivities (81:19 to 95:05). Similar reaction of curcumins with azodicarboxylates in the presence of DMAP in CH3CN stopped at the single Michael addition stage affording novel hydrazinodicarboxylates of curcumins in good to excellent yields (65-85%).
